education.area: B.A. Philosophy, minor in Computer Science: Full Ride National Merit Scholarship

work.name: PwC
highlights: Developed an internal settings dashboard in Angular; deployed to ~120 apps and ~20k users firm-wide
Contributed to RESTful API in .NET to sync frontend with MongoDB database through Azure microservices

work.name: Minion AI
highlights: Built anything-to-text API across 20 different file types to feed into LLM-driven browser automation assistant
Developed web crawler using above API to collect training data; bench-marked it on 50+ domains

work.name: University of Texas at Austin
highlights: Compiled novel Global Landslide Incidents and Features (GLIF) dataset by processing ~200GB of geophysical data across 6 data sources using Google EarthEngine, GDAL and ArcGIS

Trained Random Forest models on GLIF for landslide analytics with 86.3% binary and 72.6% categorical (severity) prediction accuracy; generated static global susceptibility map from RF feature importances
Presented & published paper at the 2021 IEEE MIT URTC Conference

projects.name: TermCall
highlights: Developed in-terminal FaceTime clone using WebRTC audio/video and ASCII graphics (<100ms latency, ~30 fps)
Created, labeled, and prioritized active feature list of 23+ issues; tracking progress/bugs with Github Projects

projects.name: ClipTranslator
highlights: Used ElevenLabs API and Wav2Lip in series to dub and lip-sync videos from/to any of 29 languages
Tested 2 lip-syncing models (Video-Retalking and Wav2Lip) and deployed web endpoints for pipeline on Modal Labs, consuming YouTube IDs and returning URL of translated video in Modal NFS/Volume

projects.name: Rusty Chess Engine
highlights: Developed blazing-fast WIP chess engine built from scratch in pure Rust (4M moves/s single-threaded)
Used magic bitboards for efficient board representation and perft (performance) testing suite of 43 unique cases

projects.name: BioConceptXplorer
highlights: Used pre-trained vector embeddings of proteins/genes/chemicals from 30 million PubMed papers to explore and test undocumented molecular interactions at scale
Codon Digest winner at Bio X ML Hackathon (hackathon.bio)

projects.name: PairProgram
highlights: Fullstack app for in-browser pair programming with linting for 42 languages and list of active users
Implemented operational transformation over WebSockets for real-time multi-user editing (<10ms latency)
